com.luigisgro.cqf.fdm
Interface Derivative

All Known Implementing Classes:
BinaryCashOrNothingOption, Portfolio, VanillaOption
public interface Derivative

This interface defines the features of a derivative to be priced in the Finite Difference Method. To be able to handle derivatives of different maturities within the same analysis, a generic approach is taken with respect to time-boundary condition at maturity: the value at maturity is considered as any cash flow produced by the derivative. When a derivative generates a cash flow in a specific grid point, the cash flow is added to the grid point value during the analysis.

Author:
Luigi Sgro

Method Detail

timeToMaturity

double timeToMaturity()
Returns:
The maturity of the instrument

timeToNearestCashflow

double timeToNearestCashflow()
If a derivative generates many cash flows during its life, this method must return the time of the last one. Otherwise it will return the time to maturity. This method is used to validate the grid steps for convergence. In fact there is a constraint on the minimum time span in the analysis with respect to volatility and number of stock steps.

Returns:
The last cash flow in time

cashflow

double cashflow(double t,
                double tStep,
                double s)
The cashflow generated in a specific time period, for a given stock value

Parameters:
t - The time of cashflow
tStep - The time step
s - The stock value
Returns:
A cash flow amount if the derivative generates a cash flow at this point in time +- tStep / 2. Zero otherwise

boundaryValue

double boundaryValue(double t,
                     double tStep,
                     double s,
                     double r)
The boundary value for extreme values of the stock. This method must be called with parameters which satisfy the criteria for boundary value (high or low stock value). Otherwise the method generates a runtime exception. In fact if the algorithm calls this method from a point in the grid that do not satisfy the requirements for a boundary point, there is no way to handle it, and the algorithm must be terminated.

Parameters:
t - The point in time
tStep - The time step
s - The value of stock
r - The interest rate
Returns:
The boundary value, or raise an IllegalArgumentException if the parameters are within the range

boundaryValueOpt

double boundaryValueOpt(int it,
                        int is,
                        Grid g)
An alternative method to calculate the boundary value

Parameters:
it - Index of time step
is - Index of stock step
g - The Grid object
Returns:
The boundary value, or raise an IllegalArgumentException if the parameters are within the range
